title: League crashing my PC
body:
League is crashing my PC completely and I'm not sure why. It happens randomly and it only started when Overcharge came out and it happens a lot in Overcharge itself. It was to the point where I had to stop playing the gamemode because every game I would crash.
I've updated everything I can and I still crash every other game or so. I run GTA V at good settings and I don't crash and I can record at 1080p 60fps so I'm really confused about how League crashes me but not my more PC intensive games. 

Here's my specs:
Windows 10
AMD Radeon RX 470 
Intel Core i5-4570
8 Gb Memory GDDR5

Its not an amazing computer but Overwatch runs at 80fps at high settings so I'm hella confused why League keeps crashing. I would post a video showing the problem but.... yeah... 

Please help me soon because I really want to play League more but I don't want to play if I'm going to crash and put my teammates at a disadvantage.

replies.body:
Overcharge had a lot of really hardware intensive elements that actually gave a lot of players fps problems. I'd first check for graphics drivers of course, but also be sure to check out the steps in the [**FPS guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) for some other basic troubleshooting. 

Those steps may not fix things 100%, but it's always good to cover the basics first. After that reach out to our techs in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) with some game logs so they can see what else might need to be done!
I guess I poorly explained myself. Its not that I crash in Overcharge exclusively. I crash in normals as well.
Hmmm yea that'll be a little more troubling then. Even still, make sure to try out those FPS steps and check with the techs if that guide doesn't help!
